Day!","username":"Al_Skierkiewicz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/al_skierkiewicz/{size}/110877_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T23:10:43.942Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYou can search for my opinion in other threads recently.  However, there is no sustained load in FRC matches unless your robot gets into a pushing match.  Current varies greatly over a match and depends on robot driving, tasks and general mechanical efficiency.  Most teams will find that batteries they have not used for a year or two are likely below levels they were when new.  I have been testing batteries over the past week and a half and have found several batteries are showing less than half the Amp Hour rating they did when new.  One of the advantages of the CBA tests are that you can overlay the tests curve with previous curves and note the differences.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T23:10:43.942Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":89.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400463,"topic_slug":"battery-testing","display_username":"Al
